meanings.definition: To clear (an area) excessively of trees or vegetation.
meanings.sent1: The farmer was overclearing the land, leaving no trees for shade.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overclear the forest to maintain a balanced ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was upset at the overclearing of its favorite tree, now left out in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The overclearing of the garden made it look barren and lifeless.
meanings.sent5: Overclearing the field made it vulnerable to erosion and flooding.

meanings.definition: The act of clearing an area excessively of trees or vegetation.
meanings.sent1: The overclearing of the park led to a loss of biodiversity.
meanings.sent2: Overclearing can have negative effects on the environment if not regulated.
meanings.sent3: The overclearing of the backyard made it look like a desert.
meanings.sent4: The overclearing of the hillside left it vulnerable to landslides.
meanings.sent5: The overclearing of the forest left a barren landscape in its wake.
